3.3 Electrical safety"

⚠3.3.2 Electrical equipment is not connected to an earth leakage circuit breaker.

This is a medium priority risk .

An Earth Leakage Circuit Breaker (ELCB) is a safety device used in electrical installations with high earth impedance to prevent electric shock.

Measure 1
General approach (to eliminate or reduce the risk): -

⚠3.3.3 Protection devices are present and not function correctly.

This is a high priority risk .

Electrical circuits need protection devices at various points to isolate faults that can occur.

Measure 1
General approach (to eliminate or reduce the risk): -

⚠3.3.4 Leads are not properly insulated, they are damaged, and they are lying on the ground.

This is a low priority risk .

All electrical cables are somewhat flexible. Where applications require a cable to be moved repeatedly, such as for portable equipment, more flexible cables called "cords" or "flex" are used. Flexible cords contain fine stranded conductors, not solid core conductors, and have insulation and sheaths to withstand the forces of repeated flexing and abrasion.
